com.adobe.cq.social.commons.comments.api

Interface Comment<T extends CommentCollectionConfiguration>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SocialCollectionComponent, SocialComponent
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Asset<T>, CalendarEvent, Document, JournalEntryComment, MessageSocialComponent<T>, Post<T>, QnaPost, ReviewSocialComponent<C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAsset, AbstractComment, AbstractPost, AbstractReview

    @ProviderType
public interface Comment<T extends CommentCollectionConfiguration>
extends SocialCollectionComponent
     A  Comment represents a comment created by a user (author) on a specific target (e.g. a page, asset or
 any node for that matter). The comments are contained within a CommentCollection (see Resource.getParent().
 A comment simply provides a comment text or "message" (see getMessage() and access to various meta data,
 such as creation date, who created it, etc.


 Comments support attachments, i.e. files that are stored as part of a comment, e.g. a preview image if the comment
 is used to annotate an image.

 Comments can also support reply to a comment

      • getAttachment

        com.adobe.cq.social.commons.Attachment getAttachment(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieve an attachment of this comment by its file name.
        Parameters:
        name - The file name of the attachment.
        Returns:
        A ResourceID representing the attachment, or null if no attachment with the given name exists.

      • getAuthor

        Returns:

      • getAttachments

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.adobe.cq.social.commons.Attachment> getAttachments()
        Retrieves a map, an entry of which represents a file-name/attachment pair. The map contains all the attachments of the comment.
        Returns:
        A Map representing the available attachments, or an empty map if no attachments are present.

        java.lang.String getReferrerUrl()
